tuv.seg: A general election must be held within 30 days of the dissolution of the Dáil
Ní foláir olltoghchán a bheith ann taobh istigh de 30 lá ó lánscor na Dála
The procedure is that the Clerk of the Dáil issues a writ to the returning officer in each constituency instructing them to hold an election
Eisíonn Cléireach na Dála eascaire don cheann comhairimh i ngach dáilcheantar ag tabhairt ordaithe dó/di toghchán a reáchtáil

The Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government appoints the polling day which must be between the 18th and 25th day (excluding Good Friday, Sundays and public holidays) after the issue of the writ

Ceapann an tAire Tithíochta, Pleanála, Pobal agus Rialtais Áitiúil an lá vótaíochta nach mór a reáchtáil idir an 18ú agus an 25ú lá tar éis aon eascaire a eisiúint (ní bhíonn Aoine an Chéasta, Domhnaí agus Saoirí poiblí san áireamh)
The Minister also appoints the polling period which must consist of at least 12 hours between 7am and 10.30pm
Ceapann an tAire an tréimhse vótaíochta freisin a mhairfidh ar feadh 12 uair an chloig ar a laghad idir 7rn agus 10.30in
More information about general elections is available in the following documents:
Tá tuilleadh faisnéise faoi olltoghcháin sna doiciméid seo leanas:
• Who can be elected to the Dail
• Cé is féidir a thoghadh don Dáil?
• How do you become a Dail candidate
• Cén chaoi ar féidir leat a bheith mar iarrthóir Dála?
• Who can vote at a Dail election
• Cé atá i dteideal vótála i dtoghchán Dála?
• How do you vote in a General Election
• Cén chaoi a vótálann tú in olltoghchán?
• How are the votes counted
• Cén chaoi a chomháirítear vótaí?
• What are the rules about election expenses
• Céard iad na rialacha a bhaineann le costais toghcháin?
General election posters and signs
Póstaeir agus fógraí do thoghcháin ghinearálta

The law forbids the erection of posters or signs on poles or other structures in public places unless you have the written permission of the owner of the pole or other structure in advance of putting up the posters or signs
Ní cheadaíonn dlí póstaeir nó fógraí a chur ar chuaillí nó struchtúir eile in áiteanna poiblí gan cead scríofa bheith faighte ó úinéir an chuaille nó an struchtúir eile roimh ré
Posters are only allowed to be erected for a certain specified time period before an election
Níl sé ceadaithe póstaeir a chur suas ach le linn tréimhse áirithe roimh thoghchán
Posters can be erected 30 days before the election or from the date of the polling day order for the election, whichever is the shorter period of time
Is féidir póstaeir a chur suas ón 30ú lá roimh lá na vótála, nó ar feadh 30 lá tar éis an dáta ar a n-eisítear an tOrdú um Lá Vótála, pé acu an tréimhse is giorra
Following a general election, a party or candidate must remove posters within a 7-day period
Tar éis toghchán ginearálta, ní mór do pháirtí nó iarrthóir póstaeir a bhaint taobh istigh de thréimhse 7 lá
After that date, an on-the-spot fine of €150 is issued by your local authority in respect of each offence
Tar éis na tréimhse sin, gearrfaidh an t-údarás áitiúil fíneáil láithreach de €150 i dtaca le gach póstaer nach mbaintear
Your local authority will remove the poster as the fine is issued
Agus an fhíneáil á heisiúint, bainfidh an t-údarás áitiúil an póstaer
If a party or candidate has been issued with a fine and refuses to pay, they can be prosecuted in the District Court by their local authority to enforce payment
Má dhiúltaíonn páirtí nó iarrthóir fíneáil atá eisithe a íoc, is féidir leis an údarás áitiúil iad a ionchúiseamh sa Chúirt Dúiche chun an íocaíocht a fháil
